channel.title: BUpolitics
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUpolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Bus Tickets to Brussels: Hungary Defies EU Open Borders Despotism

item.title: Vance warns of China’s influence during Michigan rally
item.description: Vance’s rally Tuesday was the first of a series of events in Rust Belt swing states that he and Trump are visiting this week.

item.title: Nvidia's Future Relies on Chips That Push Technology's Limits
item.description: As the company pushes the chip-making envelope, manufacturing hurdles are causing delays and higher costs.

item.title: Selling America: The Army’s fight to find recruits in an angry, divided nation
item.description: Recruiters are contending with a confounding array of political, social and economic crises that have made it harder than ever to find citizens willin...

item.title: Massachusetts Driver’s Licenses for Illegal Aliens: A Look One Year Later

item.title: Trump, Harris lay out tax plans with trillions of dollars on the line
item.description: With a huge swath of Trump’s 2017 tax cuts set to expire at the end of next year, the presidential candidates are putting down markers on the issue.

item.title: Starlink Caught in Crosshairs of Elon Musk's Battle With Brazil
item.description: An order to freeze the satellite internet business’s finances comes the same week that Brazil’s Supreme Court threatened to ban X.

item.title: Fentanyl Frenzy: Record Seizures and Rising Death Toll Highlight a Crisis at the Border

item.title: Harris goes after Trump on economy and inflation in new ad
item.description: The vice president is trying to shore up the affordability argument.

item.title: Apple, Nvidia Are in Talks to Invest in OpenAI
item.description: The tech giants would join a multibillion-dollar funding round alongside Microsoft and Thrive Capital.

item.title: Trump and Vance’s false and misleading rhetoric on tariffs
item.description: American consumers, not foreign countries, pay most of the cost of tariffs, though estimates vary on the increase.

item.title: ‘America is not a museum’: Why Democrats are going big on housing despite the risks
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris is trying to flip the script and own an issue impacting large swaths of Americans.

item.title: Asian Chip Stocks Retreat, Following Nvidia Lower
item.description: Asian semiconductor stocks broadly retreated on Thursday, tracking U.S. artificial-intelligence chip giant Nvidia’s tumble overnight.

item.title: Harris breaks from ‘Bidenomics’ in North Carolina
item.description: The vice president makes her pitch in North Carolina, where Democrats have long hoped to flip the closely divided state.

item.title: OpenAI in Talks for Funding Round Valuing It Above $100 Billion
item.description: Thrive Capital and Microsoft are among the investors putting several billion dollars into the ChatGPT maker.

item.title: 3 takeaways from Kamala Harris and Tim Walz’s first major interview
item.description: Harris addressed her changed positions obliquely and walked a very fine line on trying to run as a “change” candidate.
